author: Metalshaper
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2017
review_content: Idea, construction, and display is all great. Execution is not the smoothest. The dark blue is so dark you can‚Äôt read what has been etched in. Not really usable.

author: MamaBear03
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2016
review_content: These are so fun to have around! They scratch off perfectly and not like others that you struggle with just to see any line of color. I'm looking forward to encourage the kids to write fun notes/pictures for each other, friends, and family. Perfect for birthday cards. I love them and am looking forward to add fun notes in the kids lunch box and backpack :)My only complain is that I wish it came with a couple more sticks. Four sticks would have been perfect!

author: AR
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2018
review_content: The 'rainbow' note cards arrived with only green and a tiny edge area of yellow.  ONE card did have the rainbow effect- which may have been the first/top card in the deck.  omg.  Regardless, the 7-year old enjoyed using the cards, but the topic of conversation throughout playtime was "Only green AGAIN!".  $7+ is too expensive for non-rainbow note cards.  PS  Don't use these cards in a car-- too much black 'crumbs' to clean up.  Suggest putting a paper towel under cards when using/scratching off the black coating, for easier clean-up.

author: Keri Ronk
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2017
review_content: The range of background color on these scratch art notes is lacking. All of the notes in my pack have the same background. Variety would have been nice! I expect more from Melissa and Doug products.

author: Maumauklan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2016
review_content: These are a lot of fun.  They have entertained my 5 children and husband and I.  BUT, the box we received was mainly blues, with yellows in the very corners only.  I would have liked to have more colors as shown in the advertised picture.  But, nonetheless these have provided a lot of fun and creativity.  If the colors were as advertised, this would definitely be a five star product.

author: Gracegast
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2016
review_content: Due size I recommend to use a toothpick to draw instead of the stick provided in the set.Nice quality. It just peel off the part you remove, i mean, if you draw a line you will get a neat line. Other brands peel off more then your drawings .The size es very small. Just like post-it notes. But the small box have many mini notes so you shoul have a lot of fun!*We use them to make Christmas cards by glueing 2 together on speciality paper.....SUCCESS!!*We use them as gift tags.....SUCCESS!!Great as non-messy craft for kids while waiting at doctor's office, or waiting for dinner or any time.Store some in your car for road trips

author: Mark
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2016
review_content: What it should tell you in the description is these are mostly blue. It includes a thin line of green and a thin line of yellow. 95% of color is blue. author: kitty
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2016
review_content: These are the most fun things ever. I've gotten my niece and nephew a variety of the scratch art projects, but when I found these I knew I could stock up and let them create their own art and patterns. The trouble now is getting them to pace themselves through the pack! My sister is an artist and also took a stab, creating gorgeous, post-it sized artworks for the fridge.  I will get these for anyone who has kids between 5-15 from now on.

author: CC‚ú®üë©üèª‚Äçüç≥‚ú®
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2019
review_content: Love the presentation.  Makes a great gift.Problem is that the darker colors - purple specifically - are barely visible on the black scratch sheets.Makes it hard to see or read whatever you‚Äôre drawing or writing. You end up ditching the dark ones and re-doing then on another sheet hoping you get the rainbow. Many other reviews echo this.My pics show Melissa and Doug‚Äôs sheet with the hearts (the purple in the middle being more visible on my photo than in real life where it‚Äôs super dull and barely visible) next to purple ladybug novelty‚Äôs larger scratch art sheet. author: Michael J Mc Dermott
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2018
review_content: Let's call this what it really is, scratch art post-its minus the sticky side... Picture of this product makes it look way bigger than it is. author: Wes
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2018
review_content: The pack I receives is only a darker green, with a strip of yellow at the bottom

author: Beth Seng
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 9, 2020
review_content: I gave two of my grandchildren these rainbow mini notes for their birthdays. They did enjoy them at first.  I was excited about giving them, but I am now realize something that is not good about them. Most of the colors are vivid and beautiful, (yellow, green, orange, red) and lovely artwork can be done with those colors. But many of them have a very dark blue, which hardly shows up when the black is scratched off.  I was working with my grandchildren and making a hummingbird with a flower. You can see from the photo how the hummingbird hardly shows up. The photo itself shows the blue more vivid than the actual color. It really is almost black. It would have been beautiful if the color would have been light blue or another color rather than so dark.
title: I'm disappointed

author: Small~Town~Girl
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2017
review_content: I purchased this for the grand kids (mostly) to enjoy when they come to visit. However, EVERYONE enjoys them, kids, adults, and everyone in between. I will put them out on the table when we are visiting and I always end up with lots of cute pictures to hang on the fridge or wherever. If I don't already have it out on the table, the kids will usually ask if they can do scratch art¬†  Melissa & Doug Scratch Art Rainbow Mini Notes (125 ct) With Wooden Stylus          . For this price, they can enjoy a lot of scratch art!  For Christmas this year, they each received a¬†  Melissa & Doug Scratch Art Sketch Pad With 12 Scratch-Art Boards and Wooden Stylus          ¬†and I sent a¬†  Melissa & Doug Deluxe Combo Scratch Art Set: 16 Boards, 2 Stylus Tools, 3 Frames          ¬†to a niece. Each of these scratch art choices have been happily received and loved. Great gifts! Great to have on hand! Love them and, more importantly, so do the kids!!
title: ~ Well-Loved by ALL ~

author: Kef000dm
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2020
review_content: I bought this for myself because I enjoyed this type of ‚Äúdoodling‚Äù when I was younger - and then I decided to get 2 extra boxes and made up ‚ÄúTake Care of YOU‚Äù stress relief gift bags for my coworkers.  We are essential workers, working for the Department of Corrections and the Pandemic has taken its toll on us.  These are VERY relaxing to do and I love that if you make a mistake, you can correct it and continue designing.  I will definitely get more when they run out!UPDATE!  8/42020 -  I have read many, many comments about this product!  All I can say after making 21 stress relief bags for my coworkers  - all I have heard back from them is THANK YOU - these are so fun!  Yes, there are some that have more of one color instead of the ‚Äúrainbow‚Äù expectation - but consider how it is made!  Inking up a huge piece of canvas with all the colors - and then cutting into small squares- you are BOUND to get a square of dominant color with minimal additional colored mixed in with your multi-color squares!  Come on people!  We are talking about a post-it size card to doodle on in the fashion it was intended for - scratch and enjoy!  For the price of less than $16.00  - I brought joy and stress relief and appreciation to 21 coworkers with a homemade cut off wooden skewer and 10 fun cards - heck - my 3 y/o grandson is over the moon about theses - no matter what color shows up!  Get a grip people!
title: GREAT STRESS RELIEVER!!! Adults will LOVE this - and Kids will find it fun!

author: Felicia Ninness
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2019
review_content: I bought these to take to work with me, and we all love them!  They're a lot of fun to use and give to each other.
title: Super Fun!

author: StaceyB
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2020
review_content: My kids love the Melissa & Doug Scratch Art Box of Rainbow Mini Notes, I love them, and we all think they're fun to write on. My only wish is that they came with more than one "pencil," so that several can write or draw on them at the same time. Sometimes I'll write a quick note to the kids on this and they LOVE it...more than any other paper/post-it/notecard that I have used. The colors are bright, and it's nice that the black is thick enough that a small scratch across the surface won't take the black off and reveal the color underneath. This is my second time purchasing, and I will be purchasing again as the kids are delighted to see the color underneath!
title: So fun!

author: Bozarth
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2020
review_content: I work in Medical Imaging in a hospital. Monday's are pediatric appointments. The parents with their kiddo's sometimes have to wait a bit for their turn to be taken back for their scan. These kids will be sedated so they cannot eat anything that day until after their scan. This is a recipe for hungry, cranky kids, and parents unable to make it better. I bought a pack of these neat rainbow scratch cards to keep in my desk. When I see a child in need of distraction, I grab a card or 2 and a paperclip (to scratch with) and offer it to them with instructions to make a pretty picture for their Mom or Dad. These have been a big hit and I'm very pleased with my purchase. This box will last a long time and I will re-order when I need to. As a bonus....kids are being creative with these rather than staring at the screen of a phone or tablet.
title: Perfect for my needs

author: Dee in Hong Kong
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2020
review_content: Our girls love scratch art. We have been through a lot of these over the years, so I bought these notes based on reviews. They are a good idea. I like that you get a lot of notes, and a handy stand to keep the stick in. My only problem with this is that so far, all the notes have been a bit dull. Not like the bright colours in the photos, more like bland red yellow and green. I hope to find some brighter ones as the pack goes on. Fingers crossed.EDIT: My daughter has scratched around two dozen notes now, and they‚Äôre mostly green red and yellow- nothing like the bright colours in the advertisement. Disappointing! It‚Äôs a good concept but poorly executed. I wouldn‚Äôt buy again nor recommend.
title: UPDATE: Cute but colours a bit dull/boring

author: Samie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 24, 2019
review_content: I think I just overlooked the fact that they were "mini".  I was expecting small to be like note pad size, not post-it size.  If I wasn't on the losing end (20% restocking fee), I'd return it to be honest.  Definitely not worth $9 bucks.  The idea is great, we've purchased larger scratch art pads from Lakeshore Learning stores and they've been a hit, but I recall getting more bang for my buck.  Do they work?  Yes.  Are they fun?  Yes.  Did my daughter still have fun with the mini notes?  Yes, for all of 5 minutes as she scratched her way through all 125 tiny pages.  You win some, you lose some.
title: Not worth $9 bucks but...

author: Spanishtchr
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2020
review_content: These little scratchables are perfect for my 4 year old granddaughter. She loves to write her name and draw on them. They always look so pretty. One complaint: her favorite color is purple. There is no purpleüò¢

author: CyndyF
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2019
review_content: I purchased this product to make notes to my kid to place inside their lunch boxes for school. In the picture, the colors all look bright and vibrant which is why I purchased it. I was very disappointed when I wrote on them as there is a section on each card that has a dark blue color. When I write, you can't see the words properly as they blend in with the black background. You have to angle the card sideways in the light to try read the writing. The dark blue does not match the bright red and yellow colors and therefore the end result does not look very exciting. My kids love getting these notes but they struggle to see the words appearing in blue. I wish they had used vibrant colors on the entire card.
title: Disappointing

author: socal
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 25, 2019
review_content: "this scratch art is very fun." - the 5 year oldI think this is a lovely product. The stylus is not too sharp, and the almost poster board thickness papers are very easy to scratch. In the picture, the left top page is from the bottom of the stack, the other three are from the top. The color distribution seems to vary throughout the stack, making each page unique. I found this as a gift for my daughter's friend and at $8 I just had to get one for our family. Great activity for solo or groups.

author: Jnae
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2016
review_content: I love this little scratch art pad.  Sometimes I just need a break and a little distraction to let my brain breathe so I pull this out and make all sorts of designs.  You do get a little of a mess by scratching the black off but I usually have a big mess cause I end up scratching the whole thing off.  Can't help it.  Kid at heart I guess.

author: Becky

author: CowMoo
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2019
review_content: The very first square had wonderful coloring underneath the wax surface. author: sabrina

author: BayonettaK
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2020
review_content: I love Melissa and Doug products, and we‚Äôve bought rainbow scratch art sheets before, but the size and compact packaging of this is really really great. The kiddos scratch on them when they‚Äôre having breakfast, or watching educational videos online, it‚Äôs great for mindless doodles during phone calls or for homework brain breaks.Our pad has already been halfway used, so I will likely be buying this again..and again..and again. author: Kay
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 31, 2018
review_content: I gave 4 stars only because today it was pouring rain at my house and the box was left where it was soaked. author: Peggy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2019
review_content: Everybody loves this!! It is so fun to use and the colors are bright and beautiful! All the kids and adults in our house can't get enough of writing on this paper! The black doesn't rub off unless you want it to. I highly recommend this product. Please mark if you find my review helpful. Thank you so much!

author: Amanda Z
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2019
review_content: i was worried that this was kind of a cheap gift that she would just kind of toss to the side, but to my surprise, out of all the loot she got for xmas, she wanted to open these right away. I was also worried that the wooden stick would pose an issue to scratch of the black, but i was surprised that her drawings were looking amazing. i understand i wouldn't want anything sharper than a wooden stick for a 6yr old to scratch with, but it was doing the job perfectly. i read lots of complaints that this set is small. this is true. its only a few inches square. to me that is perfectly ok, because call me a bad mom for this, but i just simply don't have space to save all of her creations, so i feel a little less bad throwing away a small little thing instead of full sheets of this stuff. so to me this actually helps me feel like i can keep MORE of her creations since they don't take up too much space at all. and although small, you get a pretty hefty stack of them for the price. overall very happy with my purchase.
title: 6 year old daughter loved it

author: Rebecca Phillips
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2020
review_content: To be completely honest I was quite disappointed in this product. The concept seemed cool and thought it would make a good stocking stuffer for my daughter. Idea awesome. Definitely need to improve the actual writing utensil

author: Desna Rudd
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2019
review_content: You're essentially scratching black gunk of rainbow colored paper here. It's a little messy and difficult to write on. It's like a lottery scratch off, if you don't hold the paper down, you cant write on it, it's too hard to scratch through the black gunk. I don't recommend this for office use. Maybe for use at home but have clean up supplies handy

author: Sara Ack
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2013
review_content: I'm a Kindergarten-8th grade art teacher and use these at the end of my classes in any left-over time after clean-up.  The kids go crazy over them (I've had a lot of instances of kids begging for extra, and even attempting to steal them).They are wonderful because they are so cheap for the amount, and entrance rowdy children.  I mostly use them in the last 5-10 minutes of class after clean-up from an intense project.  The kids focus their energy on these immediately and calm down, ready to move back into their regular studies.  They also work great as rewards.They only come with 1 stick for the 120-something sheets, so if you are using these in a classroom you will need to order additional styluses.  Some packages have a variety of color schemes, and some packages have sheets with only red, green, and yellow on them, which bums out some of my kids who have seen the more colorful ones.  I've ordered about 10 of these cubes  in the last few months and half of them had many colors, and the other half were of the red, green, yellow variety.
title: Wonderful in the classroom

author: Jonesy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2020
review_content: Was a big hit. Not messy like most scratch art items. My 8 yr old grandaughter was thrilled and she spent hours at a time creating artwork. I actually felt triumphant when she sat for atleast an hour engrossed in creating art ... without losing interest and begging for you tube streaming or cell phone games.It was such a good feeling!!üòÅü§ó

author: Adam Terry
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2020
review_content: These are adorable and the best gift! I bought them for my daughter for Christmas and she hasn't stopped playing with them! author: Christie Macias
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2020
review_content: My son is 8 years old and is resistant to arts and crafts activities. We bought this because it was a good price and a cute piece to add to his new bedroom. We have taped some of his pieces on his door and he is so proud of his artwork. I love how this product has inspired him. I highly recommend. :)

author: Brittany B.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2020
review_content: I bought this for my daughter as a stocking stuffer for Christmas! I remember using these when I was in school and they are just as awesome as I remember! Its definitely a fun little activity we do together and for $6.99 we got a ton of them! Makes a great gift!

author: Danni
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 14, 2016
review_content: My family LOVED these! I purchased them for my niece's 7th birthday along with a separate art kit and extra wooden styluses to scratch (I felt that the one that came with the box would go missing fairly quickly with a 7 year old). Well, upon opening the box, she had no idea what it was so, I had to show her. I wrote her name in cursive on one of the sheets AND the rest is history! Her eyes grew big in childlike awe while she grabbed a sheet for herself. After showing her mother and the rest of the adults around, we quickly had 6 adults at the dining room table scribbling along with her. It's so cool and yet simple. She LOVED it, we LOVED it. It was definitely a win for the family and we had something to do other than watching movies and playing the same old board games (it rained all weekend). There is a slight odor to the sheets when opening the box initially but nothing really notable in our case. But, we also used them in a huge, open space. I will be purchasing these again and would definitely recommend!
title: Fun for the whole family!

author: johnny0723
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2020
review_content: My little girl loved this christmas present. The pictures come out amazing, as you can see in my attached photo. I gave it 4 out of 5 stars because we recently found that the local Dollar Tree store sells these for just $1 instead of like $6 for these name brand ones. Pricing aside, these are great gifts for the little artists in your family!

author: Steven G.

author: Kindle Customer

author: Maddy

author: DMV Mom

author: Melanie

author: Karthik

It brings out your daughters creativity and allows her to express herself. It also improves her hand-eye coordination and promotes fine motor skills. I would highly recommend for using this product.

author: SnowyCocaLlama
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 1, 2019
review_content: Fun and entertaining for both children and adults alike. Our children love these and have so much fun scratching different details over the rainbow background. They want the holographic scratch papers now too.The package came quickly and on time. The brand of Melissa & Doug we have used for years, some things have questionable quality, but most products are good, including this one, and the hours of imaginative play encouraged by their products never fails.

author: Trazz
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2019
review_content: These were super disappointing. Ordered 3 different types for stocking stuffers for 3 kids. This was one of the 3 the pads. As other reviewers stated it will have sheets that are barely 2 colors in a blend which makes for super uninspiring art. One of the similar products https://www.amazon.com/Rainbow-Scratch-Mini-Notes-Stylus/dp/B07218YVCZ was the total opposite being composed of lots of different color circles creating great variety in the artwork, I would recommend that instead. The child who received this product was really bummed out compared to her siblings with the other products. On top of that the other products shipped almost immediately which was a factor for Christmas, this product just squeaked in arriving barely before. Would not buy again.

author: AKgirl 85
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 26, 2016
review_content: This was a huge hit for my 7 year old daughter and her friends. There's enough there that she was able to share with everyone at her birthday party, and still felt like she had a lot to play with herself. In fact, we have had this for over a month, and she and her sister still have some left, and still enjoy making pictures and notes. This is something boys and girls of all ages can enjoy. Our crowd was aged 5-16, and all of them thought that these were the coolest thing ever. Hint: If you lose the wooden stylis, you can use a toothpick to do the scratching...Ways the company could improve this product: Vary the pattern/design/colors underneath. My daughters scratched ALL of the black off of several of these, and, yep, they all have exactly the same colors and pattern. Exactly. Confirmed by children, who went, "aw, man!" It would be cool if the company would change things up a little so that you didn't know what was underneath. Maybe even throw in a few that are sparkly silver or something. Add some variety. Just a suggestion. Still a good product, regardless.

author: Kingy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2013
review_content: I got these with low expectations and was shocked to see how wrong I was. They are well made of good card stock with a well adhered (doesn't rub off) scratch surface. The waxy black coating doesn't mark or stain and can be cleaned up easily. They cost about 8 cents a card but in the hands of a real artist or caligrapher they can be turned into fine works of art that are well worth the price. The stylus that comes with it is small and there is only one. However, if you have access to a stick you can put it in a pencil sharpener and make your own fine point stylus or extras for your friends.  Enjoy!!
title: Way better than expected!!!

author: Mom of Many
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 24, 2018
review_content: I bought these to keep many kids of all ages happy on an extended family trip.  When we go on family vacations, I try to plan for a different little fun surprise each hour (or just lots of things on plane trips to keep them quiet and happy).  With all different ages and interests of kids, that can get tricky, especially trying to keep it frugal.  This was one of the best hits for a long trip we took.  The teenagers and little kids could all draw fun designs and write sayings, and everybody enjoyed it.  You need more writing utensils since it only comes with one stylus, but we found that we could use lots of things -- pens out of ink, a Nintendo stylus, even a toothpick -- to draw on them.  My youngest kids had fun using up the last of them.  They're a great way to keep kids busy at a low cost.
title: Good way to keep kids happy on car or plane trips

author: HoneyüçØ
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2016
review_content: This scratch art notepad is unique and fun for all ages.The included stylus is meant to be used as a pen for writing or drawing on the paper squares, which are coated in black. When "written" on with the stylus the paper will reveal a rainbow of colors, just as shown in the photo of the product.The darker shades of the rainbow are a little hard to see when scratched, but when the paper is held at a slight angle, the darker colors show up better, looking almost translucent.The note paper is more like a stack of a nice thick cards, just right for tucking into a gift or for mailing to a friend.The set is stored in a tidy little box; you can store the stylus by tucking it in the front.Lots of fun for young and old.
title: Unique note pad of fine quality.

review_content: I love these little scratch off notes.  I put one in my daughters lunch box every day.  I leave a little room so she can draw a little on them during lunch.  Her friends seem to like them too.  I have purchased three packages.  One set did not include green, blue, or purple on the cards ( only red, orange yellow), others had all the colors of the rainbow.  Purple does not show well against the black.  No difference in packaging so I think it is just the luck of the draw whether you get all the colors or not.  My daughter doesn't seem to care either way as they are still fun.

author: J
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 13, 2017
review_content: These are so fun!  They are great for kids, adults, or anyone who wants to add color to their day.  I like to save them for special occasions and leave "good luck" or encouraging notes for my husband, but I doodle for fun occasionally too.  In Elementary School we got to do bigger versions of these and they were some of my favorite things because of the elements of mystery and surprise.  I haven't had anything with weird colors or seemingly uneven distribution of color, but nothing weirdly uniform either--they're perfect!In short:Kind of makes me feel like a kid again and can brighten up someone's day.

author: JAWIZ
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2015
review_content: There's nothing wrong with these, per se, but they were not what I was looking for.  It was my fault for not reading the description correctly.  I purchased an unopened Melissa and Doug Scratch Art portable light table (maybe 9x6?) at a rummage and it only came with maybe 8 sheets, which a kid can easily go through in one sitting.  I ordered these to use with that lighted table, but they are not made for the table, they're way too thick and the light can not shine through.  I suppose we'll use them to write notes or make pictures.
title: Not exactly what I wanted, but I guess I should have read the description more carefully.

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2013
review_content: When these arrived, opening the package was like sticking my face in my car's gas tank. The petroleum smell went straight to my head, and these went straight outside in the hopes that they'd outgas quickly. Unfortunately, they were still stinky by the time I had to bring them in for the night, and the chemical smell lingered for at least a week. After they were finished smelling like toxic waste, however, they turned into a lot of fun. It's neat to leave little rainbow notes for my husband and son, and both of them love it, too. Just beware, and hopefully have somewhere safe to stick them while they fume.
title: If you can get over the smell...

author: Jill
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2020
review_content: I originally purchased these, when they were on sale during Prime Day, for my niece and nephews but due to Coronavirus restrictions I was unable to give it to them. (I plan on buying more and shipping them directly to their house.) So... to not let them go to waste, I decided to open them and give them a try. I love these scratch cards. So much fun! I enjoy doodling while binge watching shows and the nice thing about these cards is when you are done you have a beautiful, rainbow colored  design. They are a bit messy so if you plan on giving them to a child you should probably have them sit at a table so you don't get little black scratchings all over the house.
title: A fun alternative to regular drawing

review_content: I bought this for my daughter who is 35 when she was in grade school  SHe loved it and it was a good quality. Today I bought this same item for my grandchild and it is at least half the size and cheaply made. I HATE WHEN COMPANIES CHEAPEN PRODUCTS ONCE THEY HAVE BUYERS!!!! I hate how they make it JUST a bit smaller so no one notices each production but increase the price.  Its insulting. But they are relying on the young buying this who don't remember quality and are too busy to care
title: never again

I take the ones my kids & I have drawn and just hang them up on my wall at home cuz they're just so pretty, even if the pic looks like crap! As a matter of fact, I'm investigating the idea of purchasing these in bulk to have on hand for gifts since they are just freakin' awesome... Seriously. Just buy it. If not for someone else, definitely for yourself. You deserve it. You don't even have to know how to draw.
